results.title: Paris N'existe Pas = Paris Does Not Exist
results.brief_description:
During an inspiration crisis, a young painter realises he is able to travel between two time periods. Worried about the dangers he might encounter during his time travels, his friends try to take him away from his ‘hallucinations’. The situation of the artist in his time and society is the main theme of this film inspired by surrealism.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Roch Rognoni ; director, Robert Benayoun ; writer, Robert Benayoun ; photography, Pierre Goupil ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Richard Leduc, Daniele Gaubert, Serge Gainsbourg, Monique Lejeune, Denise Peron.

results.title: Paris la nuit
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Como Films, Jacques Baratier and Jean Valere
results.brief_description: An impressionistic approach to documentary film production utilising a variety of striking images which at times suggest an almost surrealistic sense of humour. Jacques Baratier and Jean Valere have captured Paris nightlife in 1956 featuring its streets and inhabitants, cabarets, Chansonniers and other entertainments, its lights and edifices. As the night progresses, Parisians return to their homes and venues close as markets prepare to open. Excellent cinematography by Maurice Barry. A film without dialogue, incorporating songs in its soundtrack.

results.title: Paris Jamais Vu

A breathaking aerial discovery of Paris, including a passage under the Arc de Triomphe.

Credits: Director, Albert Lamorisse ; writer, Roger Glachant ; photography, Albert Lamorisse, Guy Tabary.

results.title: Paris is burning
results.brief_description: Paris is Burning is the result of the five years film-maker Jennie Livingston spent amongst New York City’s black and Hispanic transvestite community. Often poor and homeless the young gay men and drag queens form “houses” which conduct dances and balls dedicated to vogueing: the celebration of fashion, style and beauty. This is a fascinating documentary which confronts the viewer with a blurring of traditional notions of gender and sexuality and which also celebrates sexual, ethnic and racial diversity and difference. Features a great soundtrack of house and funk music. Winner of Best Documentary at the 1991 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Paris 1900: Chronique de 1900 a 1914
results.brief_description:
This is a montage of archival footage, newsreels and photographs evoking the political, social and artistic life of Paris at the turn of the century. The ironic tone of the narration underlines the contradiction between the sweetness of the period and the cataclysm of World War I. Personnalities appearing include: Gustave Eiffel, Marcelle Linder, Liane de Pougy, Caroline Otero, Cleo de Merode, Colette, la Comtesse d’Uzes, Buffalo Bill, Charles Pathe, Ferdinand Zecca (Pathe), Ferdinand Zecca, Andre Gide, Paul Valery, Guillaume Apollinaire, Louis Bleriot, Felix Mayol, Maurice Chevalier, Mistinguett, Polin, Sarah Bernhardt, Polaire, Jean Mounet-Sully, Leon Bonnat, Auguste Renoir, Claude Monet, Auguste Rodin, Leon Tolstoi, Jean Jaures, Aristide Briand, Leon Blum, Arthur Meyer, Maurice Barres. Includes segments from ‘Ceux de chez nous’ directed by Sacha Guitry. Reference: Forum des Images. http://www.vdp.fr

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, writer, Nicole Vedres ; music, Guy Bernard ; assistant director, Alain Resnais ; editor, Yannick Bellon.
Cast: Claude Dauphin [narration].

results.title: Paris 1900
results.creator_credit: Arthur Mayer, Edward Kingsley and Pierre Braunberger
results.brief_description: A re-creation of Paris between the years 1900 and 1914, assembled from extracts from contemporary newsreels and other films. Great ladies, actresses and beauties, famous politicians , sportsmen and artists and the varied incidents of those years - from Bleriot’s flight across the channel to the eve of the 1914 war. Narrated by Monty Woolley.

results.title: Parents who work
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: Thomas has a sore throat but is sent to school due to his parents’ commitments at the office. Should Dad or Mum have stayed at home? This program looks at parenting and dual responsibility, the importance of forward planning employers’ attitudes to women with families, how and why employers should help and how to negotiate with a partner.

results.title: Parents are people too
results.brief_description: Discusses adolescent feelings of resentment against authority and emphasises the role of the parent, the teacher, and the adolescent himself in resolving differences. Shows how family discussions can replace arguments and help establish good family relations.
